description: From Latin nivalis, from nix, nivis (“snow”).

adjectives.description: nival (comparative more nival, superlative most nival)

entries.meaning: Abounding with snow; snowy; snow-covered (now especially in reference to plant habitats).
examples: It includes the nival mountain top, the moorlands above the timberline, a belt of tropical rainforest, the semihumid footzone of the tertiary volcano, the semiarid high Laikipia Plateau, the escarpment, and the semiarid to arid Samburu Plains.

entries.meaning: (botany) Found or thriving in snowy conditions.
examples: In 1884 O. Heer published a comprehensive account of the nival flora of  Switzerland, in which he listed 338 species of flowering plants found above 2600  m.; of these, 6 were found above 3900 m.
